page.title: 06TOURISM The Marble Church
page.content: One of the best known attractions on the North Wales coast is the Marble Church at Bodelwyddan.It is known as the "Marble Church" because of the varieties of marble used in its interior construction . Built of local limestone,the church has a spire which rises to a height of 202feet and this can be seen many miles away down the vale. Tourists who visit the church are struck by its outstanding beauty .The exquisitly carved lectern in the form of an eagle perched on a rock with both wings outspread, and the Pulpit which is a fine example of English wood carving of the Nineteenth Century both fascinate visitors to the church. Throughout the year the church is open to visitors and many thousands enter through its doors annually .
